Given that you're looking for a war film that surprises you emotionally, I'd highly recommend "Windtalkers" (2002). This film tells an intriguing story about U.S. Marines protecting Navajo Marines during World War II, who use their native language as an unbreakable radio cypher. Notably, it stars Nicolas Cage and Noah Emmerich.

Another option that could appeal to you is "Gone with the Wind" (1939), a classic romantic drama set against the backdrop of the American Civil War. It follows the tumultuous relationship between Scarlett O'Hara, played by Vivien Leigh, and Rhett Butler, portrayed by Clark Gable. This film is known for its powerful emotional depth and captivating performances. Enjoy your movie time!

Given your interest in war-themed films set in different eras, I'd recommend "Flags of Our Fathers" (2000) for its captivating portrayal of six U.S. Marines who raised the flag at Iwo Jima during World War II. Starring a talented cast including Ryan Phillippe and Paul Walker, this film offers an insightful look into their lives post-war.

If you're keen on exploring a different time period, "The Best Years of Our Lives" (1946) is another compelling choice. It follows the stories of three veterans returning home from World War II and the challenges they face reintegrating with society. Starring Myrna Loy and Teresa Wright, this classic film showcases the profound impact of war on families and individuals. Enjoy the movies!
